body_html:
Ubuntu 17.04, kernel 4.10.0-40-generic, cuda v8.0.61, gcc 4.9.4, conda 4.3.21, python 3.6.2

Just to be clear, installing in a fresh virtualenv gave me the same error. I tried updating from pytorch 0.2 to check if mkl gets upgraded but it is not, all I get is this:

The following NEW packages will be INSTALLED:

    cudatoolkit: 8.0-3                           

The following packages will be UPDATED:

    pytorch:     0.2.0-py36h53baedd_4cu80 soumith [cuda80] --> 0.3.0-py36_cuda8.0.61_cudnn7.0.3h06d1a12_1 pytorch
    torchvision: 0.1.9-py36h7584368_1     soumith --> 0.2.0-py36h17b6947_1                       pytorch

Also I find it a bit weird that I don't have libmkl_gf_lp64.so anywhere in the system. I have multiple virtualenvs and most of the shared mkl libraries are where they are supposed to be, except this one.

body:
Ubuntu 17.04, kernel 4.10.0-40-generic,  cuda v8.0.61, gcc 4.9.4, conda 4.3.21, python 3.6.2

Just to be clear, installing in a fresh virtualenv gave me the same error. I tried updating from `pytorch 0.2` to check if `mkl` gets upgraded but it is not, all I get is this:

```
The following NEW packages will be INSTALLED:

    cudatoolkit: 8.0-3                           

The following packages will be UPDATED:

    pytorch:     0.2.0-py36h53baedd_4cu80 soumith [cuda80] --> 0.3.0-py36_cuda8.0.61_cudnn7.0.3h06d1a12_1 pytorch
    torchvision: 0.1.9-py36h7584368_1     soumith --> 0.2.0-py36h17b6947_1                       pytorch
```

Also I find it a bit weird that I don't have `libmkl_gf_lp64.so` anywhere in the system. I have multiple virtualenvs and most of the shared mkl libraries are where they are supposed to be, except this one.
